channel.title: How to make music on the computer?
channel.description:
Does anybody know how you can make your own MIDI-files (.mid) files? Is there any free program for it, and (maybe) a good tutorial? I searched on Google, but that didn't get me any useful hits. :mad: Please help me. :(
Thanks in advantage. :)
~Supamagier

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

idc about illegal or legal, half my software is illigal. But thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Okay, I’ll try to get them both. You can only get FL Studio free via Bittorrent, or it’s also just freeware, downloadable from their site or something?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make music on the computer?

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

FL Studio is more for mixing than recording. Cubase is used in recording studios, and FL Studio is a lot more for mixing or using a synth.
You can get both programs for free, look around on the torrents.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make music on the computer?

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

On another topic

FL Studio is amazing. It comes with loads of preset effects and instruments, and you can also add your own.

It sounds like FL Studio is more for the amateur user. Seems better than Cubase for me, but for someone such as the professional singing teachers at my school they’d be better off using Cubase.

This is just my assumption by the way, I haven’t actually tried FL studio.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make music on the computer?

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

On another topic

Cubase can suck my dick. Try FL Studio.

Is FL Studio better? I haven’t tried it.

Though I’m not sure if I’d use it. I only used Cubase for composing for my GCSE coursework and GCSE’s are basically over so I don’t really need to compose anymore.

Read full topic

item.source: How to make music on the computer?

item.title: How to make music on the computer?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Most music programs have built in midi stuff. Such as Cubase which I am sort of familiar with. The great thing about cubase is that you can edit/create midis but also do a shit stack more.

You could try out cubase, the only annoying bit is that cubase is very expensive, but i’m sure you could find a way to use it ;).

Also another program you might consider in case you play a little bit of guitar and that is “Guitar Pro”, I use it all the time, whats useful is that it is very user friendly to guitar players.

Anyways have a look at the programs I mentioned.

Read full topic
